meanings.definition: A condition of the eye in which distant objects are seen more clearly than near objects.
meanings.sent1: Many older adults develop hyperopias, making it hard to read up close.
meanings.sent2: His hyperopias meant he could see the mountains clearly but struggled with his phone screen.
meanings.sent3: The hyperopias of the telescope made it great for stargazing but terrible for reading.
meanings.sent4: Her hyperopias were like having a built-in binocular for faraway sights.
meanings.sent5: The hyperopias of the camera lens captured the distant landscape beautifully.

meanings.sent1: His hyperopias caused him to squint when trying to read small print.
meanings.sent2: The hyperopias of the eagle allow it to spot prey from high above.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's hyperopias made him the best lookout during family hikes.
meanings.sent4: The hyperopias of the owl are essential for hunting in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The hyperopias of the lookout tower helped spot ships approaching the shore.
